I have purchased this game on every console I have ever owned that could run this game. Call of Duty I believe is a dying franchise, but what I can respect is the game it put out in 2015. Yes, the campaign is not super good, but everything else is just perfect. Multiplayer is fun as hell and my personal favorite exo COD to date. I enjoyed the seemingly endless amount of weapons that were added during this game's lifecycle. Yes, the supply drop system is dated and pretty trash, but it was fun for a little bit. 

However, the real meat and potatoes of this game to me in my opinion is zombies (I am very bias to zombies). Zombies is one of the first things I ever really nerded out at. Every video online I've watched. Every secret and easter egg I've seen. The lore I can recite like its the back of my hand. So imagine my surprise when one of the most unique storylines I have ever seen came to a close. BO3 zombies is without a doubt one of my favorite times of my life. The maps were amazing. The story was amazing. It was so amazing that they even remastered eight classic fan favorite maps two years after this game had come out. The dedication the team at Treyarch had for zombies really showed and it was a time to be alive. The Z House. The ending. Zombie Chronicles. Man, good times. Time really does fly. 

This is a very bias review for one of my favorite games in my entire life, mostly just for my favorite gamemode in all of gaming. I won't ever forget the excitement and fun I had/have still playing this game to this day. When I built my PC thanks to the help from my friends in 2023, one of my first purchases was BO3 AGAIN. The custom zombies maps had always been a dream of mine to play and let me tell you it is just fantastic what people can come up with when given the materials to create. That alone is a selling point for me. Endless fun even when the game is done. Yes, this is a love letter to this game, but I hope this love letter finds the right person when considering buying an older COD title. If you are to buy any, buy this one. Do yourself a favor and play zombies, especially custom zombies. You will not be disappointed.

Call of Duty: Black Ops III marks the pinnacle of the Black Ops series, catapulting players into a futuristic world filled with advanced technology, augmented soldiers, and intense multiplayer battles. Developed by Treyarch, this installment in the iconic franchise offers a compelling blend of campaign, multiplayer, and zombies mode, each delivering its own unique experience. Let's delve into every aspect of this action-packed title.

Campaign:
The campaign in Black Ops III takes players on a mind-bending journey through a dystopian future, where mega-corporations wield immense power and augmented soldiers fight for survival. The narrative is complex, weaving together themes of technology, identity, and morality. While the story can be convoluted at times, the stunning visuals, adrenaline-pumping set pieces, and memorable characters keep players engaged from start to finish.

One of the standout features of the campaign is the introduction of cybernetic enhancements, which grant players new abilities such as enhanced strength, speed, and hacking capabilities. These abilities add a layer of depth to the gameplay, allowing for creative approaches to combat and traversal.

Multiplayer:
Black Ops III's multiplayer is where the game truly shines, offering fast-paced action, diverse maps, and a wide array of customizable loadouts. The movement system has been revamped, introducing advanced mobility mechanics such as wall-running and thrust jumping, which add a vertical dimension to the gameplay. While some purists may lament the departure from traditional boots-on-the-ground combat, the new movement mechanics inject a sense of fluidity and dynamism into matches.

The multiplayer suite features a variety of game modes, including classics like Team Deathmatch and Domination, as well as new additions like the objective-based War mode. Additionally, the Pick 10 system allows players to fully customize their loadouts, selecting weapons, attachments, perks, and scorestreaks to suit their playstyle.

Zombies Mode:
Zombies mode makes a triumphant return in Black Ops III, offering a thrilling co-op experience filled with hordes of the undead, elaborate Easter eggs, and challenging boss fights. Set in a variety of imaginative locales, from a medieval castle to a futuristic cityscape, each map presents unique challenges and secrets to uncover.

The mode features a progression system that rewards players with new weapons, perks, and cosmetic items as they survive wave after wave of zombies. With its blend of survival horror and arcade-style action, Zombies mode provides endless replayability and cooperative fun for players of all skill levels.

Graphics and Sound:
Visually, Black Ops III impresses with its detailed environments, realistic character models, and stunning visual effects. From the neon-lit streets of Singapore to the war-torn landscapes of Ethiopia, each location is brought to life with impressive attention to detail. The sound design further enhances the immersion, with powerful weapon sounds, atmospheric music, and dynamic voice acting adding to the intensity of the experience.

Conclusion:
Call of Duty: Black Ops III is a tour de force in futuristic warfare, offering a compelling campaign, exhilarating multiplayer, and addictive zombies mode. While the campaign's narrative may be ambitious and occasionally convoluted, the gameplay more than makes up for any shortcomings with its tight controls, diverse customization options, and adrenaline-fueled action. Whether you're a fan of single-player storytelling, competitive multiplayer, or cooperative zombie slaying, Black Ops III has something to offer for everyone. It's a testament to Treyarch's skill and creativity, cementing its place as one of the standout entries in the Call of Duty franchise.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 transcends the typical first-person shooter experience, offering a multifaceted gaming masterpiece that leaves an indelible mark. The single-player campaign is a futuristic odyssey, expertly crafted with a compelling narrative that seamlessly integrates with adrenaline-pumping action. The stunning graphics and fluid gameplay mechanics create an immersive journey through a visually captivating world.

Yet, the true longevity and magic of Black Ops 3 unfold in its Zombies mode, where the modding community emerges as the unsung hero. The standard Zombies experience, with its intricate maps and cooperative gameplay, is a delight on its own, but the modding community breathes new life into the undead saga. Custom maps, imaginative weapons, and inventive game modes transform the Zombies experience into an ever-evolving adventure.

The modding community's dedication and creativity shine through, offering a diverse range of player-generated content that caters to every taste. Whether you're craving a nostalgic throwback to classic Zombies maps or seeking fresh, innovative challenges, the modding scene provides it all. The depth and variety of user-created content enhance the replayability, ensuring that no two encounters with the undead are ever the same.

The thriving modding community not only extends the game's lifespan but also fosters a sense of community among players. Sharing and experiencing custom content with fellow enthusiasts elevate the overall enjoyment and sense of camaraderie within the Call of Duty community.

Beyond Zombies, Black Ops 3's multiplayer component delivers fast-paced, strategic engagements that cater to both casual and competitive players. The diverse selection of maps, well-balanced weaponry, and the introduction of Specialist characters add layers of depth and excitement to the multiplayer experience.

In conclusion, Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 isn't just a game; it's an immersive journey enriched by a dedicated modding community. The game's versatility, combined with the creative contributions of players, cements Black Ops 3 as a timeless classic within the franchise, demonstrating the enduring power of collaborative gaming experiences.

First off, $60 is crazy for a game that came out 9 years ago, and it's not even a good game. As for the campaign, confusing and BORING!! This might just be me so take this with a grain of salt, but still. I would say it was because I played this when I was 14, but I played the Black Ops 1 and 2 campaigns and I was able to enjoy those and I could follow the story the whole way through and Black Ops 2 is one of my favorite games ever just for its campaign, however every single time I went to play the Bo3 campaign, I felt like I was gonna fall asleep. I didn't even finish it and I'll tell you why that is. First off, I just did't care that much so I stopped playing it for a while. That was like a few years ago. The other day, I decided to continue the campaign, went to load up the game, nothing. I tried everything. Verifying game files, running as admin, compatibility mode, running steam as admin, uninstalling the game, clearing the entire Bo3 folder from my pc, nothing has worked. Maybe I'm missing something but I think I know the issue. I have bought 14 cods, 5 gave me issues like this. What do all 5 of those have in common? They're all for PC. In total, I have 8 cods on PC, and 6 cods on Xbox (360 and One/Series X/S) none of which have given me problems. Out of the 3 PC games that haven't given me issues, 2 I've only played once so who's to say if I tried to open one of them rn, and the other one is Cod 2003 which is for PC only so it would be weird if it didn't even work for the system it was made for, but it is cod so... This could just be my computer, but lemme tell you why I think it's not. First off, I don't have issues like this with any of my other games, and if I do, it's something I'm able to fix easily. The other reason is cuz I've heard that cods are not very PC friendly games. Wish I'd known that before I spent about, and I kid you not, 5 HUNDRED dollars on games that would eventually not work. If your curious, this nonsense caused me to have to wipe my save file when I was on the last mission of one of these games making me have to redo like 5 hours of gameplay at least on a game that wasn't even that good, and making 3 games unplayable, including this game, and Bo2. I wouldn't be too mad about this since it's not the best game if A: I'd already finished the campaign, and B: if it didn't cost me $60. To get us back on track, If you're thinking about buying this game, it's not the worst game out there, but personally, I wouldn't recommend it, especially if this is your first cod since there are way better ones. If that's the case, I'd recommend starting with an older game like Modern Warfare ORIGINAL because the campaign starts off with a tutorial showing you some basic mechanics which is helpful. If you've played Cods before, but this is your first Black Ops, I'd recommend starting with Black Ops 2010 and working your way up to Bo3 from there if you really want to. If you do decide you want to play Bo3, don't get it on steam. Play it on Xbox or PlayStation or something and same goes for any other cod (besides Cod 2003 obv) and if you don't have one of those then I'd highly recommend getting one and if you can't and you still really wanna play this game then get it on here, but still be aware of the issues that may occur.

Pros:
-The zombies maps are creative and pretty and fun
-The multiplayer maps are pretty good
-The guns are punchy and feel good
-The "time to kill" an enemy is about right. I hate that so many modern games feel like I'm shooting a weak squirt gun.
-There just isn't a game like Call of Duty. People can call it stale, but there aren't games that have that feel. I don't want a Battle Royale or massive maps or 64v64 battles or vehicles or lasers or super powers or any of this "bigger, better, badder" type nonsense. I like my nice and tight Call of Duty formula.
-Even if they are very few, there are real people playing. They are not bots. There are real people.

Cons:
-Even on sale, expensive for what it is
-There should be more maps, especially classic maps. They marketed "Zombie Chronicles" like you were getting a ton of old gems. Not really. You get some, but there are many missing that will die off never to be seen again. The map I miss the most is "Five"
-Multiplayer can't be played as of me writing this. I can see it says there are people online, but it says there are 0 matches. -You have to download a thing called BOIII client to play multiplayer. Multiplayer does work there, but you're stuck playing with the same small group of people over and over, and I'm pretty sure they're cheating. 72 kills and 3 deaths in Team Deathmatch? ADSing around a corner where you can't see me and obliterating my face the moment I pop up? Come on.
-I do not like that in multiplayer, some of the player models are robots. Shooting robots is not fun.
-In multiplayer, the players have jetpacks or something all the time. It makes players jump super high constantly. It's not a hack or a mod. It's part of the "futuristic" feel. I hate it. I want more grittiness and less futuristic nonsense. Same reason I hate shooting robots.
-I'm not sure if this game has multiplayer perks like older CoD games. What it does have is various heroes you can choose from who have different abilities. I hate that. Just give me the old CoD formula that made Blops1 and MW2 and MW3 so great.
-People tend to say that multiplayer is dead and zombies is the only thing keeping the game going. I don't even know if zombies is keeping the game going. There are very few players. I go on and see like 5 people playing zombies at any given moment.
-There is some kind of dangerous hacking thing going on. I don't know how real that is. I play through a VPN and scan my computer often. Supposedly, the danger is that a hacker could get your IP address and/or your steam username and mess around with your computer. "Bob, the Accidental Ballet Dancer - A Black Ops 3 Odyssey"

Have you ever dreamt of a game where you can seamlessly transition from a [b]stealthy sniper mission[/b] to accidentally pirouetting through a hail of bullets? Look no further than [b]Call of Duty: Black Ops 3[/b] – the unexpected masterpiece that turned my virtual soldier into [b]Bob, the Accidental Ballet Dancer[/b].

[b]Pros:[/b]

[b]Immersive Storytelling:[/b] I never thought a game about military ops could make me question the meaning of life, but here I am, pondering the universe between headshots.

[b]Character Customization:[/b] Forget bland soldiers; meet my custom character, [b]Sir Prance-a-Lot[/b]. He's here to waltz through war zones with style.

[b]Zombie Mode Extravaganza:[/b] Because nothing says survival like dodging undead creatures while executing a perfect cha-cha slide. Bonus points for including dance-offs with the undead.

[b]Cons:[/b]

[b]Physics Gone Wild:[/b] I'm not sure if the developers attended a dance class or a physics lecture, but the unintentional twirls and spins my character does are worth the price of admission.

[b]AI Dance Partners:[/b] The AI comrades could use some dance lessons. Instead of covering my six, they're busy perfecting their own interpretive dances. Teamwork, right?

[b]Weaponized Confetti Missing:[/b] With all the chaos, where's the option to equip a confetti launcher? Imagine turning a firefight into a celebration of bullets and glitter. A missed opportunity.

[b]Overall,[/b] [b]Black Ops 3[/b] is a rollercoaster of emotions, from the gripping storyline to the unexpected dance recitals on the battlefield. If you've ever wanted a game that combines tactical warfare with inadvertent interpretive dance, look no further. Just don't forget your tutu and tap shoes – you're going to need them.

Call of Duty: Black Ops III: A Thrilling Journey into the Future of Warfare

Call of Duty: Black Ops III takes players on an adrenaline-pumping journey into the future of warfare, where advanced technology blurs the lines between humanity and machines. Set in a dystopian world where cybernetic enhancements have become commonplace, the game follows a new breed of Black Ops soldiers as they navigate the treacherous waters of a new Cold War.

A Groundbreaking Movement System

Black Ops III introduces a groundbreaking movement system that allows players to traverse the environment with unprecedented fluidity and agility. Controlled thrust jumps, power slides, wall-running, swimming, and fast mantling capabilities combine to create a dynamic and exhilarating gameplay experience. This new movement system opens up a whole new world of possibilities for both offensive and defensive maneuvers, adding a fresh layer of depth and complexity to the Call of Duty formula.

Immerse Yourself in a Gripping Narrative

The single-player campaign of Black Ops III is a captivating tale of espionage, betrayal, and redemption. Players take on the role of a new generation of Black Ops operatives, tasked with unraveling a conspiracy that threatens to plunge the world into chaos. The campaign is filled with twists and turns, keeping players on the edge of their seats from start to finish.

Engage in Intense Multiplayer Battles

Black Ops III's multiplayer mode is a non-stop adrenaline rush, featuring a variety of maps and game modes that cater to all playstyles. From frenetic close-quarters combat to strategic long-range engagements, there's something for everyone in Black Ops III's multiplayer arena. The game also features a deep progression system that rewards players for their skills and dedication.

Unleash the Undead on Zombies

The Zombies mode in Black Ops III takes players on a thrilling journey through the depths of hell. Players must work together to survive against hordes of undead enemies, solving puzzles and unlocking new areas as they explore the labyrinthine maps. The Zombies mode is a fan favorite, and its return in Black Ops III is sure to please longtime players and newcomers alike.

Overall, Call of Duty: Black Ops III is a must-play for fans of the series and newcomers alike. Its groundbreaking movement system, immersive narrative, and intense multiplayer and Zombies modes make it a thrilling and addictive experience.

Pros:

Groundbreaking movement system
Captivating single-player campaign
Intense multiplayer battles
Enthralling Zombies mode
Cons:

Can be overwhelming for newcomers
Story can be a bit convoluted at times
Some multiplayer maps may not be to everyone's liking
Verdict:

If you're looking for an adrenaline-pumping first-person shooter with a unique twist, then Call of Duty: Black Ops III is the game for you. It's a must-have for any fan of the series, and it's sure to keep you entertained for hours on end.

Overrall: Depending on the person, a zombies fan would be a 10/10. A multiplayer/campaign fan would be probably a 2/10.

Call of Duty®: Black Ops III : By Triple F

"Call of Duty®: Black Ops 3" takes the iconic franchise to new heights, delivering an adrenaline-pumping experience that seamlessly blends the best of what fans love about the series with innovative game-play elements that push the boundaries of the genre. Treyarch has truly outdone themselves with this installment, creating a game that not only honors the roots of Call of Duty but also propels it into the future.

The campaign of Black Ops 3 is a mind-bending roller-coaster that blurs the lines between reality and virtuality. The story's intricate layers of conspiracy and intrigue kept me hooked from start to finish. The addition of cybernetic augmentations to the game-play adds a unique twist, allowing players to unleash a range of abilities that elevate the tactical game-play to new heights. The level design is nothing short of spectacular, whisking players across a variety of stunning environments that range from gritty urban sprawls to high-tech facilities. The narrative's philosophical musings on the nature of humanity and technology are thought-provoking and add a layer of depth that's rare in the FPS genre.

Black Ops 3's multiplayer is the heart and soul of the game, and it's not hard to see why. The fast-paced combat, combined with the wide array of weapons, equipment, and Specialists, keeps every match feeling fresh and exhilarating. The introduction of wall-running and advanced movement mechanics adds a vertical dimension to the game-play, encouraging players to rethink their strategies and embrace a more dynamic play-style. Whether you're a fan of close-quarters combat or long-range sniping, there's a load-out and a play-style for everyone. The map design is exceptional, catering to various play-styles and providing a perfect balance between tight corridors and open spaces.

Zombies mode has always been a fan-favorite, and Black Ops 3 takes it to a whole new level. The maps are intricate, sprawling, and packed with hidden secrets to uncover. The inclusion of an XP progression system and customizable Gobblegums adds a layer of RPG-like depth to the mode, giving players more reasons than ever to keep coming back for more undead-slaying action. Whether you're teaming up with friends or braving the zombie apocalypse solo, this mode offers endless hours of eerie fun.

Visually, Black Ops 3 is a treat for the eyes. The level of detail in the environments, character models, and weapon designs is astounding. The game's futuristic aesthetic is well-executed, and the dynamic lighting and particle effects immerse you further into the game's world. The sound design is equally impressive, with explosive gunfire, thunderous explosions, and subtle ambient sounds all coming together to create a truly cinematic experience.

In conclusion, "Call of Duty®: Black Ops 3" is a triumphant entry in the franchise that manages to strike a perfect balance between innovation and the classic Call of Duty formula. Its gripping campaign, adrenaline-pumping multiplayer, and addicting zombies mode combine to create an experience that's greater than the sum of its parts. Whether you're a long-time fan of the series or a newcomer looking for a gateway into the world of modern military shooters, Black Ops 3 is an absolute must-play. In the sea of shooters, Black Ops 3 stands tall as a testament to the series' enduring appeal and the developers' commitment to pushing the boundaries of the genre. This is a game that will keep you engaged, thrilled, and coming back for more long after the bullets have stopped flying.

Prime rib
Ingredients
1 whole rib eye roast (you can use boneless or bone-in prime rib) about 14 pounds
6 tbsp. olive oil, divided
4 tbsp. tri-color peppercorns (or any peppercorns)
3 sprigs rosemary
3 sprigs thyme
1/2 c. kosher salt
1/2 c. minced garlic
Directions
1
Preheat oven to 500°F. Remove the roast from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
2
Cut the rib loin in half (roast halves separately for more controlled/even cooking.)
3
Heat a large skillet over very high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of oil and sear both halves until they're a nice dark golden color. Place the tricolor peppercorns into a bag; use a rolling pin to crush the peppercorns. Strip the leaves from the rosemary and thyme springs. Mix the salt, crushed peppercorns, rosemary leaves, thyme leaves, and garlic. 
4
Pour the remaining 4 tablespoons of olive oil over the rib loin and pour on the rub mix. Pat slightly to get it to stick to the meat. Roast for 20 to 30 minutes, then reduce the heat to 300°F and roast until a meat thermometer registers 125°F for rare/medium rare, 30 to 50 minutes (the roast will continue to cook slightly after removing from the oven). If you'd like the meat more cooked, leave it in the oven longer. Just keep an eye on the meat thermometer and don't let it cook past medium rare! *USING A MEAT THERMOMETER IS VERY IMPORTANT TO ENSURE YOU COOK THE MEAT TO YOUR LIKING*
5
Remove from the oven and let rest at least 20 minutes before slicing.

Intraocular pressure (IOP) refers to the fluid pressure inside the eye. The eye contains a clear fluid called aqueous humor, which is constantly produced and drained to maintain the shape of the eye and provide nutrients. Intraocular pressure is essential for maintaining the structural integrity of the eye.

Normal intraocular pressure ranges between 10 and 21 mmHg (millimeters of mercury). Elevated intraocular pressure can be associated with conditions such as glaucoma, a group of eye diseases that can lead to optic nerve damage and vision loss. Monitoring intraocular pressure is crucial in assessing the risk of glaucoma and managing the condition.

Regular eye examinations, including measurements of intraocular pressure, are important for detecting and managing eye conditions. Treatment options for elevated intraocular pressure may include medications, laser therapy, or surgery, depending on the underlying cause and severity of the condition.

In conclusion, Black Ops 3 Zombies is a triumph within the game, providing a dynamic and entertaining experience with its exceptional mod support. Whether you’re seeking immersion or lighthearted fun, playing with friends amplifies the thrill. The Zombies mode is not just a game; it’s a cooperative adventure, a chaotic romp, and a testament to the enduring legacy of undead mayhem.

A strong link in the chain of the fence of the Black Ops series, this chapter is more of a continuation of a successful trend than a groundbreaker. Its story is solid and its characters are relatable, but core elements of the gameplay remain very much unchanged, specifically the guns and the accessories . Whilst the weapons are fun to shoot and offer a fair range of useful accessories to make aiming and precision better, other games offer more inventive addons for the firearms. BO3 presents enhancements to weapons that have been seen before and the lack of energy weapons makes the year 2065 look too dated to be believeable. The air fighter battles in the refinary level offer some exciting moments and a little change, but otherwise, nothing else is original.

The cybernetic suit upgrade system is good. The wall running ability, speed  boost and the rush attacks come in handy in the most intense encounters,  but the invisibility mode doesn't last long enough  and can lead to awkward moments in which the player can be caught off guard or trapped in between enemies.  

Overall, a step in the right direction that doesn't feel futuristic enough. Advanced Warfare does what Black Ops 3 should have done, in that it adds more innovative aspects to the game. I recommend this game only to the fans and those who want to follow the storyline and face a very contagious enemy, which ends up becoming the best feature of the game.

“ERROR. You have been disconnected from the Call of Duty: Black Ops III Servers”. I’ve seen this message 10+ times in my 12 hours of gameplay, each time disconnecting me from a solo or multiplayer zombies match. It’s not just a disconnection; all progress is lost, no statistics are saved, I cannot level my profile or my guns. I do not gain currency for the Doctor’s factory, and I lose all progress in the Easter Egg. For those unfamiliar with the Easter Egg, it can take hours to complete, and the fact that on multiple separate occasions, both myself and my friend are disconnected two to three hours into the Easter Egg, losing all progress and being forced to start from scratch, is unacceptable. I’ve already lost connection twice this morning playing solo, and that was the final straw. I've spent hours on Google and YouTube, scouring the internet for a fix, but after that much research I've determined that no solution exists. I’ve forwarded my ports, run the game as administrator, run the game in compatibility mode, checked for system updates, checked for graphics cards updates, tried playing on three different internet providers at different friends houses, and the connection issues persist. The game is unplayable unless you are looking to play offline entirely, which means you’re sacrificing a significant portion of the game, as offline statistics do not affect your profile. Elden Ring, WoW, Starcraft, and Diablo 4 all run flawlessly; I’ve never been disconnected from any of these games. This issue is buried in the code of Black Ops 3, and it’s apparent that it will never be fixed or addressed. I hold no ill will toward Steam; I’ve been a loyal account holder for years, and love the service, but as I said, this game is unplayable, and I've requested a refund. Should you need additional evidence, there are pages of complaints on this very issue, spread across all platforms.
